note: Curated list of common smart device manufacturers, representative models, connectivity options, and key features. Use this KB to surface device setup flows in the RoomWizard.

manufacturers.name: SwitchBot
manufacturers.notes: Consumer-focused accessory maker; many devices connect via BLE and rely on a Hub for cloud/Wi‑Fi integration.

manufacturers.name: TP-Link (Kasa)
manufacturers.notes: Kasa devices use local TCP/HTTP APIs on the LAN for many models; widely supported.

manufacturers.name: Sonoff (ITEAD)
manufacturers.notes: Popular for DIY; many users re-flash Sonoff with Tasmota or ESPHome to get local MQTT integration.

manufacturers.name: Shelly
manufacturers.notes: Small, local-first devices frequently used in commercial projects; first-class MQTT/local API support.

manufacturers.name: Tuya / Smart Life (multiple OEMs)
manufacturers.notes: Huge ecosystem of rebranded devices; local control varies. Many support Tuya cloud or can be integrated via Tuya local/virtual APIs or Tuya-convert alternatives.

manufacturers.name: Philips Hue (Signify)
manufacturers.notes: Enterprise-grade lighting ecosystem with a local bridge and robust API.

manufacturers.name: LIFX
manufacturers.notes: Wi‑Fi bulbs that expose a local LAN API, widely used where Zigbee isn't desired.

manufacturers.name: Yeelight (Xiaomi ecosystem)
manufacturers.notes: Often supports local control modes and has community integrations.

manufacturers.name: Meross
manufacturers.notes: Consumer brand; some models have cloud-only operation unless reworked.

manufacturers.name: Ecobee / Nest (Google)
manufacturers.notes: Highly popular HVAC/thermostat devices, typically cloud-first but with established ecosystem integrations.

manufacturers.name: Bluetooth LE sensor makers (generic)
manufacturers.notes: Used for low-power sensors (temp/RH/soil) and often require a hub or a BLE gateway for cloud/local bridging.

manufacturers.name: Sonos / commercial audio
manufacturers.notes: Included as example of networked devices that may be present in grow-room installations (alerts/music).

manufacturers.name: Tasmota / ESPHome (custom firmware)
manufacturers.notes: A large portion of commercial/DIY devices can be re-flashed to Tasmota/ESPHome to provide local MQTT-based control.
